column5: This is one of the Totem lodges and you boat to this outpost lodge. Great fishing and nice lodge.

Tons of options up there. May help to narrow down what you are looking for in fishing. Looking for numbers of Walleye? Big Walleye? Trophy Northern? Smallmouth action?Or maybe narrow it down by how far north you desire to go. Saw the one post that listed the Sunset Country Website. Have used that site numerous times to narrow down the search.I personally go to Five Lakes Lodge on Gullrock. Can bring your own boat. I also had a great trip into Woman River Camp last year. Again can bring your own boat.May want to look at how long the drive is on gravel when taking your own boat. Five Lakes it is just the length of the driveway on gravel. Woman River is about 30 miles.Also going into decision is do you want to cook your own meals or have them cooked for you? Are you looking for 5 star accommodations or just basic cabins.A lot of choices out there.
Also, where do you live and how far are you willing to drive? Is budget a concern?
Ash Rapids Resort LOTW near Shoal Lake.Walleyes Bass Muskies
Can anyone recommend a good lodge that a fella can take his own boat and still have great fishing. Ps I have a warrior v208
Witch Bay Camp ! PS. They dont care what size boat you have !
Lots of choices for drive in camps. https://visitsunsetcountry.com/
Birch Dale Lodge on Eagle Lake, Vermilion Bay, Ontario WWW.Birchdalelodge.com 807-227-5262 owners name is Marcel.
I'll be in a 14 footer with a 9.9 turbo engine,with warriors in the boat seats.
Have great friend take loves Witch Bay, so second the recommendation, I love Halley's Camps, Caribou Falls Landing, NW of Kenora.
Gawley's Little Beaver just south of Ear Falls. Nice cabins and docks.
I've fished Witch Bay and it is a good operation and has good fishing. Brett
try North Albany Lodge on Pashkokogan Lake north of Ignace just off 599 - HUGE lake with portage lakes available. phish
Knotty Pines Lodge on the English River. www.knottypineslodge.com
